name: Systematic Review Variables
description: Preregistration of coded variables for the systematic review

variableMeasured.name: Journal
variableMeasured.description: Name of the journal in which the article was published.

variableMeasured.name: Tests_interactions
variableMeasured.description: Whether the article tests at least one interaction term in a statistical model or using an anova.

variableMeasured.name: Uses_non_identity_link_function
variableMeasured.description: Whether at least one of the tested interaction is presumably analyzed with a non-identity link function (e.g., because a generalized linear model was used).

variableMeasured.name: Explicit_link_function
variableMeasured.description: Whether the link function is explicitly defined for at least one statistical model in the article (that is, in this case just indicating which generalized linear model or family was used is not enough; we code whether at least one link function is explicitly declared).

variableMeasured.name: Incorrect_identity_link_function
variableMeasured.description: Whether at least one tested interaction is analyzed using an identity link function when another, non-identity link function would be more appropriate.

variableMeasured.name: Finds_significant_interactions
variableMeasured.description: Whether at least one interaction (where the link function was incorrectly specified as identity) yields a statistically significant result, or is considered and discussed in an analogous way if non-frequentist (e.g., Bayesian) analyses were carried out.

variableMeasured.name: Response_variable_types
variableMeasured.description: A list of of the types of response variables on which interactions are tested. Possible values include {Sum score, Accuracy, Error count, Response times, Ordinal/Likert, ...}. This list may be expanded.
